import os
import time
import requests
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.chrome.options import Options
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from PIL import Image
import io
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC

def get_first_image_from_google(driver, search_query):
    driver.get(f"https://www.google.com/search?q={search_query}&tbm=isch")
    try:
        # Wait for the first image element to be visible
        first_image = WebDriverWait(driver, 10).until(EC.visibility_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, 'img')))
        image_url = first_image.get_attribute('src') if first_image.get_attribute('src') and 'http' in first_image.get_attribute('src') else None
    except:
        image_url = None

    return image_url

def download_image(download_path, url):
    try:
        image_content = requests.get(url).content
        image_file = io.BytesIO(image_content)
        image = Image.open(image_file)

        # Save the image with the appropriate file extension
        file_extension = url.split('.')[-1].split('?')[0]  # Extract file extension from the URL
        if file_extension.upper() not in ["JPEG", "JPG", "PNG"]:
            print(f"Skipping image with unsupported format: {url}")
            return

        file_path = os.path.join(download_path, f"downloaded_image.{file_extension.lower()}")

        with open(file_path, "wb") as f:
            image.save(f, file_extension.upper())

        print("Success")
    except Exception as e:
        print('FAILED -', e)

# Ask the user for the search query
search_query = input("Enter your Google Images search query: ")

# Create the 'images/' directory if it doesn't exist
download_path = "C:\\Users\\shaif\\Desktop\\django-fyp-food deman prediction\\images"
os.makedirs(download_path, exist_ok=True)

# Create a Chrome driver
options = Options()
options.add_argument("--start-maximized")
driver = webdriver.Chrome(options=options)

# Get the first image URL
image_url = get_first_image_from_google(driver, search_query)

if image_url:
    # Download the image
    download_image(download_path, image_url)
else:
    print("No image found.")

# Close the driver instance
driver.quit()

import os
import time
import requests
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.chrome.options import Options
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from PIL import Image
import io

def get_first_image_from_google(driver, search_query):
    driver.get(f"https://www.google.com/search?q={search_query}&tbm=isch")
    time.sleep(2)  # Let the page load
    try:
        first_image = driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, 'img')
        image_url = first_image.get_attribute('src') if first_image.get_attribute('src') and 'http' in first_image.get_attribute('src') else None
    except:
        image_url = None

    return image_url

def download_image(download_path, url):
    try:
        image_content = requests.get(url).content
        image_file = io.BytesIO(image_content)
        image = Image.open(image_file)

        # Check if the image can be identified and is in a compatible format
        if image.format not in ["JPEG", "PNG"]:
            print(f"Skipping image with unsupported format: {url}")
            return

        file_path = os.path.join(download_path, "downloaded_image.jpg")

        with open(file_path, "wb") as f:
            image.save(f, "JPEG")

        print("Success")
        return True
    except Exception as e:
        print('FAILED -', e)
        return False

# Ask the user for the search query
search_query = input("Enter your Google Images search query: ")

# Create the 'images/' directory if it doesn't exist
download_path = "C:\\Users\\shaif\\Desktop\\django-fyp-food deman prediction\\images"
os.makedirs(download_path, exist_ok=True)

# Create a Chrome driver
options = Options()
options.add_argument("--start-maximized")
driver = webdriver.Chrome(options=options)

# Get the first image URL
image_url = get_first_image_from_google(driver, search_query)

if image_url:
    # Download the image
    success = download_image(download_path, image_url)
    if success:
        print("Image saved successfully. Exiting program.")
        driver.quit()  # Close the driver instance
else:
    print("No image found. Exiting program.")
    driver.quit()  # Close the driver instance

import os

from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait

def get_first_image_from_google(driver, search_query):
    driver.get(f"https://www.google.com/search?q={search_query}&tbm=isch")
    try:
        # Wait for the search div to be visible
        search_div = WebDriverWait(driver, 10).until(EC.visibility_of_element_located((By.CLASS_NAME, 'eA0Zlc')))
        print("Search div found:", search_div)
        # Find all img elements within the search div using XPath
        img_elements = search_div.find_elements(By.XPATH, './/img[@class="YQ4gaf"]')  # Modified XPath here
        print("Image elements:", img_elements)
        # Get the src attribute of the first img element
        if img_elements:
            image_element = img_elements[0]
            print("Image element tag:", image_element.get_attribute('outerHTML'))
            image_url = image_element.get_attribute('src')
            if image_url and 'http' in image_url:
                return image_url
        # If no img elements are found or src attribute is missing
        image_url = None
    except Exception as e:
        print("Exception occurred:", e)
        image_url = None

    return image_url

def download_image(download_path, url):
    try:
        image_content = requests.get(url).content
        image_file = io.BytesIO(image_content)
        image = Image.open(image_file)

        # Save the image with the appropriate file extension
        file_extension = url.split('.')[-1].split('?')[0]  # Extract file extension from the URL
        if file_extension.upper() not in ["JPEG", "JPG", "PNG"]:
            print(f"Skipping image with unsupported format: {url}")
            return

        file_path = os.path.join(download_path, f"downloaded_image.{file_extension.lower()}")

        with open(file_path, "wb") as f:

        print("Success")
    except Exception as e:

import os
import time
import requests
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.chrome.options import Options
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from PIL import Image
import io
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC

def get_first_image_from_google(driver, search_query):
    driver.get(f"https://www.google.com/search?q={search_query}&tbm=isch")
    try:
        # Wait for the search div to be visible
        search_div = WebDriverWait(driver, 10).until(EC.visibility_of_element_located((By.CLASS_NAME, 'eA0Zlc')))
        print("Search div found:", search_div)
        # Find all img elements within the search div using XPath
        img_elements = search_div.find_elements(By.XPATH, './/img[@class="YQ4gaf"]')  # Modified XPath here
        print("Image elements:", img_elements)
        # Get the src attribute of the first img element
        if img_elements:
            image_element = img_elements[0]
            print("Image element tag:", image_element.get_attribute('outerHTML'))
            image_url = image_element.get_attribute('src')
            print("inside first element")
            print(image_url)
            if image_url and 'http' in image_url:
                return image_url
        # If no img elements are found or src attribute is missing
        image_url = None
    except Exception as e:
        print("Exception occurred:", e)
        image_url = None

    return image_url

def download_image(download_path, url):
    try:
        # Get the image content from the URL
        image_content = requests.get(url).content
        
        # Generate a unique filename based on the current timestamp
        timestamp = int(time.time())
        file_name = f"image_{timestamp}.jpg"
        
        # Combine the download path and filename
        file_path = os.path.join(download_path, file_name)
        
        # Save the image content to the specified file path
        with open(file_path, "wb") as f:
            f.write(image_content)

        # Check if the file was successfully saved
        if os.path.exists(file_path):
            print("Image saved successfully:", file_path)
        else:
            print("Failed to save image: File does not exist.")
    except Exception as e:
        print('Failed to save image:', e)

# Create the 'images/' directory if it doesn't exist

import io
import os
import re
import csv
import time
import base64
import requests
from PIL import Image
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.chrome.options import Options
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC

# Function to read the CSV file and extract category and link
def read_csv_file(file_path):
    data = {}
    with open(file_path, 'r', newline='') as csvfile:
        csv_reader = csv.DictReader(csvfile)
        for row in csv_reader:
            meal_id = row['meal_id']
            category = row['category']
            link = row['links']
            data[meal_id] = {'category': category, 'link': link}
    return data

# Example usage
file_path = 'meal_info.csv'
data = read_csv_file(file_path)
# print(data)
recipes = {}
for key, value in data.items():
    print("Key:", key, "Value:", value)
    input = key

# input = '2704'

    url = data[input]['link']
    response = requests.get(url)
    soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser')

    # Find the <a> tag within the <div> tag with the specified class
    image_tag = soup.find('div', class_='feature-image__image-container').find('a', class_='feature-image__image').find('img')

    # Custom filename for the image
    custom_filename = data[input]['category']+'.jpg'

    if image_tag:
        # Extract the URL of the image from the src attribute
        image_url = image_tag['src']

        # Send a GET request to download the image
        image_response = requests.get(image_url)

        # Check if the request was successful (status code 200)
        if image_response.status_code == 200:
            # Specify the directory where you want to save the image
            directory = r'C:\Users\shaif\Desktop\django-fyp-food deman prediction\images'

            # Create the directory if it doesn't exist
            os.makedirs(directory, exist_ok=True)

            # Specify the file path to save the image with the custom filename
            filepath = os.path.join(directory, custom_filename)

            # Save the image to the specified file path
            with open(filepath, 'wb') as f:
                f.write(image_response.content)

            print("Image saved successfully with custom filename:", filepath)
        else:
            print("Failed to download the image.")
    else:
        print("Image not found in the HTML content.")



    # Find all <li> elements within the provided section
    li_elements = soup.select('section#content-recipe-1 li')

    # Extract text from each <li> element
    ingredients = []
    for li in li_elements:
        text = li.get_text(strip=True)
        if 'and' in text:
            ingredients.extend([part.strip() for part in text.split(' and ') if part.strip()])
        elif ',' in text:
            ingredients.extend([part.strip() for part in text.split(',') if part.strip()])
        else:
            ingredients.append(text)

# Print the extracted ingredients
    print(ingredients)
    recipes[input] = ingredients

    # Define the CSV file path
    csv_file_path = 'recipes.csv'

    # Write the data to the CSV file
    with open(csv_file_path, 'w', newline='') as csvfile:
        writer = csv.writer(csvfile)
        
        # Write header
        writer.writerow(['recipe_name', 'ingredient'])
        
        # Write each ingredient along with its corresponding recipe name
        for recipe_name, ingredients in recipes.items():
            for ingredient in ingredients:
                writer.writerow([recipe_name, ingredient])
